did.unittitle: Taxpayers' Alliance to Serve Connecticut Records.
did.abstract: This collection was started in 1993 when the Taxpayers' Alliance to Serve Connecticut lobbied the state government and the public against the balanced budget amendment, in favor of the Connecticut Income tax. It includes Publications, Administrative Records and Fliers.

bioghist.head: History
bioghist.p: The Taxpayers' Alliance to Serve Connecticut (TASC) lobbied the state government and the public against the balanced budget amendment and in favor of the Connecticut Income tax.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content
scopecontent.p: The Taxpayers' Alliance to Serve Connecticut Recordsinclude correspondence, newspaper clippings, flyers, promotional materials, as well as memoranda and information generated for use by the organization in its efforts to defeat the Connecticutbalanced budget act. Other organizations represented in the collection include:National Organization for Women, the War Resistance League, several animal rights groups and the U.S. Communist Party.

arrangement.head: Organization
arrangement.p: Series I: Organizational Files (undated, 1993-1994) The series includes newspaper clippings, property revaluation project report, publications-Organizations, publications and fliers, publications and research materials, research materials, Special briefing for Legislators and Municipal Officers.

relatedmaterial.head: Related Material
relatedmaterial.p: Archives & Special Collections has a substantial collection of alternative, grass root organization materials. For detailed information on these collections please contact the curator or ask at the reference desk.
